a deep and complex grand strategy game that lets you manage a country during the 19th century its all about economy politics and population management and once it clicks its incredibly satisfying the learning curve is steep but the payoff is worth it for fans of historical strategy a great choice if you enjoy detailed management and shaping history

this is one of my favorite games of all times i can spend hours at the computer playing this once you get into it its like crack if you have a good computer there are probably other better paradox games to play the only reason i even started playing this one was because i was dying to play a paradox game and my computer sucks ass so i had to resort to playing this 20 year old dinosaur of a game but once you get into it its amazing it is a bit hard to learn however would recommend
brutally convoluted learning curve hidden behind an obtuse ui but once you learn to navigate past that jungle youll find a true gem of a video game

this game perfectly captures the desperation of the nineteenth century at the start despite the barrage of control windows the only action available to you is raising taxes everything else is locked you need research to unlock the ability to build or change anythingbut research itself is also locked youre left in the dark fumbling for direction while other nations are lightyears ahead of you its the perfect government simulation

nothing much to say it is a classic that has stood firm throughout its many years i feel as if this game is 100x better than victoria iii even after playing both 117 hours on this and i think around 9 or 10 on victoria iii by far victoria ii gives you more options choices and potential and overall is a more enjoyable and fun experience i know a lot of my fellow players use mods but i can assure you that the 117 hours ive played only 30 minutes was with a mod vanilla is already superb
old but still fun to play sometimes sadly it needs mods for any flavour
